description: From French bibliotaphe, from biblio- + Ancient Greek τάφος (táphos, “burial, tomb”).

entries.meaning: (rare) One who "buries" books, typically by hoarding them unread, hiding them, locking them away, or otherwise shutting them up and keeping them from use
examples: He was, by his knowledge of the intellectual value of his store, a little bit of a bibliotaph: we have reason to think he had this feeling to an extent he knew nothing of himself.
